page.title: 05INDUSTRY
page.content: Braces has been the site of a wood yard since 1926.It changed very little until 1960 when the erection of a new building began on the lower half of the site.The firm deals in British and foreign timber,hardwood and softwood. The home produced hardwoods are mainly Oak,Elm,Ash,Sycamore and pine.Fir and Scotspine being the softwood.The largest imports are Lroko from west Africa,Mahogany from Brazil and teak from Burma.They also have wood from U.S.S.R,Scandinavia and North America. There are two types of kilns used for drying timber.A dehumidification type and a vaccume type{(one of the latest {and up to date methods).}The wood can stay in a kiln from 7 days to 3 months to dry properly.A joinery shop on the site now produces windows and doors. The saw mills are to be replaced in the next year or two.
